page.title: 15TRADITIONS, DEEPCAR/WORTLEY
page.content: Former customs included{Bull/Bear-bait {-ing}(Moorside Farm,1623,bear;Woodhead Rd.,bull; "King & Miller", Deepcar, bear).{'Knurr and Spell',}a Viking game similar to golf, was played locally. The ballad of{'The Dragon of {Wantley'}refers to George Blount (More of More Hall) challenging Sir Richard Wortley ('the Dragon) over land in Penistone. The Wortleys are alleged to have destroyed hamlets in order to extend Wharncliffe Deer Chase.{Current {games}include{Long Run,}a tag version of British Bulldog.{K-K Night}is at Hallowe'en when children with turnip lanterns knock on doors, sing the K-K-ing song and ask for money. An illuminated{Easter cross}is erected on Hunshelf Bank by the Christian Council. The{Sunday School Queen} tradition is 30 yrs. old. The Village Hall committee erect a{Christmas Tree.
